content.en: Algorithmic wastewater treatment: Researchers are investigating various algorithms to address important questions in wastewater treatment and environmental remediation. For example, the Rosen-Brock Optimization Algorithm is being used to determine if basic oxygen furnace slag and hydrogen peroxide can degrade 2,4-dichlorophenol wastewater. Other algorithms, such as the Box-Behnken design and desirability function approach, are being employed to study the effectiveness of Fenton type processes in minimizing organic content in simulated industrial wastewater. These studies highlight the potential of algorithms in improving the efficiency and effectiveness of environmental treatment processes.
content.da: Algoritmisk spildevandsbehandling: Forskere undersøger forskellige algoritmer for at besvare vigtige spørgsmål inden for spildevandsbehandling og miljøsanering. For eksempel anvendes Rosen-Brock Optimeringsalgoritmen til at afgøre, om slagger fra basisk iltovn og brintoverilte kan nedbryde 2,4-dichlorophenol spildevand. Andre algoritmer, såsom Box-Behnken design og desirabilitetsfunktionstilgang, bliver brugt til at undersøge effektiviteten af Fenton-lignende processer i at minimere organisk indhold i simuleret industrielt spildevand. Disse undersøgelser fremhæver algoritmernes potentiale til at forbedre effektiviteten og effektiviteten af miljøbehandlingsprocesser.
